posts_data.title: Behind The Scenes...
posts_data.content:
If you've been sat at home, impressed by the high quality of the live streams coming out of the 013, you'll not be surprised to know that there's an enormous team of people working behind the scenes, with equipment that we've never even seen before capturing these shows in all their glory! The production is more like a movie set than a regular Roadburn show. There's even a truck with all these monitors - just like Hollywood (probably).

This edition of Roadburn has been a huge undertaking - not only figuring out how to get these shows to you, but complying with various (often changing) restrictions and protocols to keep it safe for everybody. Massive thanks to everyone who has made this possible!

If you're as impressed as we are by the high level production values and incredible live streams, please consider donating to help us cover the cost of the production of Roadburn Redux. Donating is of course optional, and you are no less welcome as part of the Roadburn community if you don't contribute. Every penny helps us to continue plotting, planning and programming for the future of Roadburn too.

posts_data.title: Die Wilde Jagd - in pictures
posts_data.content: Die Wilde Jagd - captured by Niels Vinck, live from the 013 venue, Tilburg. April 17, 2021.

posts_data.title: Witch Mountain
posts_data.content: We love a birthday party! Next year, Witch Mountain will be celebrating their 25th anniversary and we’re getting things started early! Here, they tribute to one of the greatest groups from their home turf in the Pacific Northwest. A cover of Soundgarden’s Limo Wreck is the first Witch Mountain recording to be entirely produced in guitarist Rob Wrong’s 'Wrong Way Recording' studio. One further connection to the source: the song was mastered by Seattle legend Tad Doyle.

posts_data.title: Steve Von Till presents A Remote Wilderness
posts_data.content:
Is there really a headliner slot at a virtual festival that’s running at different times around the globe, that’s re-watchable at your leisure? Not sure we can answer that for sure, but if there’s a man with a set ready to fit the bill today it’s most definitely Steve Von Till. 

Filmed and recorded live at the legendary Robert Lang Studios in Seattle, Von Till performs his album No Wilderness Deep Enough in full - plus a selection of other tracks.

Von Till is on vocals, piano and guitar and is joined by Dave French (Brothers of the Sonic Cloth) on synthesiser, percussion, guitar and backing vocals, Lori Goldston (Nirvana, Earth) on cello, David Lutz on synthesiser, Eric Padget on French horn, and Olie Eshleman on pedal steel. Video is captured by Bobby Cochran, whose work you may know from Amenra’s A Flood of Light documentary.

Without further ado, please enjoy Steve Von Till’s incredible set, A Remote Wilderness.

Visit Steve's store here.

posts_data.title: Sunrot
posts_data.content: Round these parts, we’ve got a lot of time and a lot of love for Sunrot. This brand new track, titled 1312, wears its heart on its sleeve and features Zellie Imani of Black Lives Matter Paterson. It is taken from an upcoming split between Sunrot and Ides due out on May 7 via Bandcamp. All first day sales will be donated to Black Lives Matter Paterson. If this gets your heart racing and you feel like you need a moment - may we suggest checking out the third track of their recent release which is a *guided meditation* - yes really. Told you... we love Sunrot here!
